alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 24 at 3:38AM PST until February 24 at 6:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is most likely on Saturday. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal, Valley and Mountains areas. * WHEN...From this afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A winter storm will bring rain to the area today and Saturday, but the heaviest rain will fall on Saturday when rain rates of 0.50 to 0.75 inches per hour are expected. That is when flooding is most likely. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
